function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Major shift to at-home work and self-isolated society in developed countries","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of comprehensive pandemic-related considerations in the paper","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffective culture based on resilience, change management, and agile principles","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Sample bias due to limited access to wearable devices by older people and low-income populations","category":"Access to infrastructure  ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of focus on indoor health factors","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Limited understanding and awareness of health in buildings among building professionals","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Professionals’ responses may vary based on individual perspectives and biases, leading to subjective data collection.","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mix of academia and industry respondents may lead to conflicting views on occupant health in buildings.","category":"Disinformation and Misinformation","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Unequal focus on physical well-being in research","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited research on social well-being in the built environment","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High levels of stress, depression, and anxiety due to stay-at-home mandates and lack of social connections.","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Collaboration needed between building scientists and health professionals","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need for more research on mental well-being in built environments","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited awareness and education among building professionals about the impact of their decisions on occupant health","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of collaboration between building practitioners, health professionals, and data scientists in enhancing the design of healthy buildings.","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective collaboration between project stakeholders","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disparities in health conditions based on income and race","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Resistance to the healthy building movement","category":"Vulnerability risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Scarcity of real-world cases and lack of confidence in healthy building initiatives","category":"Misinformation and Media Risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Generalizing results from a sample dominated by engineers, architects, and facility managers","category":"Misinformation and Media Risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Pandemic bias effect on questionnaire responses","category":"Misinformation and Media Risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Increased focus on physical and mental well-being in building occupant health","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on questionnaires as the primary method for studying and measuring occupant health may lead to incomplete or biased data.","category":"Misinformation and Media Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Major focus on office buildings in research studies and practice-based efforts may neglect other types of buildings that also impact occupant health.","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of understanding about the effect of building attributes on occupant health","category":"Misinformation and Media Risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Absence of an effective collaboration framework between different stakeholders of a building","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of clear and commonly accepted definition of ’healthy building’","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited systematic process to incorporate who’s definitions of health in buildings","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global epidemics of stress and longer working hours may impact occupant mental and social well-being in buildings.","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Elevated negative emotions, aggressive behaviors, and mental fatigue due to indoor air contaminants","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of exposure to natural light affecting mood, sleep quality, and vitamin d levels","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate access to natural views contributing to job stress in office workers","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of physical activity opportunities in buildings leading to occupant health issues","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of widely accepted occupant health assessment standard","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient visual comfort leading to eye strain, fatigue, and reduced cognitive performance for occupants","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sub-standard building conditions in low-income and minority households","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate housing conditions leading to poor indoor air quality","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Residential segregation based on race and ethnicity","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher level of indoor air pollutants in african american and hispanic houses","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Racial segregation and lower housing standards leading to health burden on children","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate working conditions for laborers and employees in blue collar jobs","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of integration between social, environmental scientists and engineers in developing a framework of health in the built environment","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of conceptualization of built environmental justice and health inequalities","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased sick leaves and presenteeism due to unhealthy buildings","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited understanding of the link between building and occupant parameters and their impacts on physical, mental, and social health","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate spatial arrangements and movement restrictions may lead to crowding and increased transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of antibacterial fabrics and finishes may lead to a false sense of security and reduce adherence to proper hygiene practices.","category":"Vulnerability risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of interdisciplinary approach to understanding health implications of buildings","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of home quarantine","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relationship of the house with the exterior, including windows and balconies, has been important during the pandemic for visual and auditory socialization and well-being.","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"High"}]}
